WorkItem.Description:
Can anyone help with the below issue.
 
After running, sudo apt-get update and upgrade on my ubuntu server, my php script that generates an excel report no longer works, i checked the apache 2 error logs and it has returned.
 
[Tue Aug 07 09:33:53 2012] [error] [client 192.168.249.34] PHP Fatal error:  Uncaught exception 'Exception' with message 'Invalid parameters passed.' in /var/www/finance/admin/includes/PHPExcel/Writer/Excel2007/Workbook.php:254
Stack trace:
#0 /var/www/finance/admin/includes/PHPExcel/Writer/Excel2007/Workbook.php(225): PHPExcel_Writer_Excel2007_Workbook->_writeSheet(Object(PHPExcel_Shared_XMLWriter), '', 1, 4, 'visible')
#1 /var/www/finance/admin/includes/PHPExcel/Writer/Excel2007/Workbook.php(80): PHPExcel_Writer_Excel2007_Workbook->_writeSheets(Object(PHPExcel_Shared_XMLWriter), Object(PHPExcel))
#2 /var/www/finance/admin/includes/PHPExcel/Writer/Excel2007.php(277): PHPExcel_Writer_Excel2007_Workbook->writeWorkbook(Object(PHPExcel), true)
#3 /var/www/finance/admin/reports/meritforce/mfBookDte.php(178): PHPExcel_Writer_Excel2007->save('php://output')
#4 {main}
  thrown in /var/www/finance/admin/includes/PHPExcel/Writer/Excel2007/Workbook.php on line 254
 
Any ideas?

Comments.Message: What exactly did you update/grade with sudo apt-get update ?
Guessing that you have a worksheet without a title
It updates the kernal, repositories and packages on the server.
That's what I thought it did, so what packages on the server did you actually upgrade? new version of PHP? new libxml?

not sure exactly - how would i find out?

I think PHP, mysql etc all upgraded.
Well start by doing a phpinfo() and give me the details of PHP version, etc from that.... then tell me what version of PHPExcel you're using

I got the same problem. I use debian 6 as a production server, and this update broke phpexcel:

php5-xsl:i386 (5.3.3-7+squeeze13, 5.3.3-7+squeeze14), clamav:i386 (0.97.3+dfsg-1~squeeze1, 0.97.5+dfsg-3~squeeze1), php5:i386 (5.3.3-7+squeeze13, 5.3.3-7+squeeze14), clamav-freshclam:i386 (0.97.3+dfsg-1~squeeze1, 0.97.5+dfsg-3~squeeze1), php5-sqlite:i386 (5.3.3-7+squeeze13, 5.3.3-7+squeeze14), clamav-base:i386 (0.97.3+dfsg-1~squeeze1, 0.97.5+dfsg-3~squeeze1), php5-tidy:i386 (5.3.3-7+squeeze13, 5.3.3-7+squeeze14), libclamav6:i386 (0.97.3+dfsg-1~squeeze1, 0.97.5+dfsg-3~squeeze1), php5-snmp:i386 (5.3.3-7+squeeze13, 5.3.3-7+squeeze14), php5-gd:i386 (5.3.3-7+squeeze13, 5.3.3-7+squeeze14), php-pear:i386 (5.3.3-7+squeeze13, 5.3.3-7+squeeze14), php5-curl:i386 (5.3.3-7+squeeze13, 5.3.3-7+squeeze14), php5-pspell:i386 (5.3.3-7+squeeze13, 5.3.3-7+squeeze14), php5-xmlrpc:i386 (5.3.3-7+squeeze13, 5.3.3-7+squeeze14), php5-mcrypt:i386 (5.3.3-7+squeeze13, 5.3.3-7+squeeze14), php5-recode:i386 (5.3.3-7+squeeze13, 5.3.3-7+squeeze14), php5-imap:i386 (5.3.3-7+squeeze13, 5.3.3-7+squeeze14), php5-intl:i386 (5.3.3-7+squeeze13, 5.3.3-7+squeeze14), php5-mysql:i386 (5.3.3-7+squeeze13, 5.3.3-7+squeeze14), php5-cli:i386 (5.3.3-7+squeeze13, 5.3.3-7+squeeze14), php5-dev:i386 (5.3.3-7+squeeze13, 5.3.3-7+squeeze14), libapache2-mod-php5:i386 (5.3.3-7+squeeze13, 5.3.3-7+squeeze14), php5-common:i386 (5.3.3-7+squeeze13, 5.3.3-7+squeeze14)

When using getProperties()->setTitle("insert title here");  phpexcel throws an message similar to the shown in the first post.

commenting the setTitle operation will return nothing, and no error will be logged, but no file will be produced either. No idea what's went wrong, but the change effectively killed phpexcel. Yes i'm using the lastest production version.

Ok. i've investigating a little, and a workaround is to comment out all the appereances of getProperties()->setTitle("insert title here");

Of course that means you can't save named worksheets, but at least you can get some data from the server.
